thread.title: Trump’s Pick for Navy Secretary Has Withdrawn His Nomination
thread.title_full: Trump’s Pick for Navy Secretary Has Withdrawn His Nomination

author: Ken Meyer
title: Trump’s Pick for Navy Secretary Has Withdrawn His Nomination
text:
Trump’s Pick for Navy Secretary Has Withdrawn His Nomination by Ken Meyer | 7:46 pm, February 26th, 2017 
Philip Bildren , the businessman President Trump picked to be Navy Secretary, will withdraw his nomination. 
There have been indications in the past week that Bildren was thinking of taking himself out of the running, though the White House denied this was the case . Previous reports suggested that Bildren was having trouble disentangling himself from business interests based in Hong Kong, and he wouldn’t achieve Senate confirmation if he was unable to satisfy ethics and financial disclosure requirements. 
Defense Secretary Jim Mattis confirmed Bildren’s withdrawal in a statement on Sunday night, saying the decision was based on conflict of interest concerns: Mattis statement confirming Philip Bilden’s withdrawal as Navy secretary https://t.co/JGw98vzbVn pic.twitter.com/sB6SWOEKDb 
— Jeremy Herb (@jeremyherb) February 26, 2017 
Bildren’s withdrawal comes after Trump picks Vincent Viola and Andy Puzder took themselves out of the running respectively for Army Secretary and Secretary of Labor. 
[Image via screengrab]
